emails.subject: Protocol DNL-123 - Query re: Part A Screening Exclusion Criteria
emails.body:
Hi Ben,

Hope you're having a good week.

We have a potential healthy volunteer for Part A of the DNL-123 study who is interested in screening. During the pre-screen review, we noted their liver function tests (LFTs) are slightly above the upper limit of normal (ULN). Specifically, their ALT is 1.2x ULN.

The protocol exclusion criterion #5 states 'Clinically significant abnormal laboratory values,' but it's a bit ambiguous for this specific case. Could you please provide clarification on the acceptable range for LFTs for healthy volunteers in this part of the study? We want to ensure we are interpreting this correctly before proceeding with the formal screening visit.

Thanks for your help.

Best regards,

Maria Garcia
Clinical Research Coordinator
Westwood Clinical Research Center

emails.subject: Fwd: Protocol DNL-123 - Query re: Part A Screening Exclusion Criteria
emails.body:
Hi Alex,

Please see the query below from the team at Westwood CRC regarding the LFT exclusion criteria for Part A.

Could you please provide the official guidance from the sponsor on this and reference the relevant protocol section?

Thanks,

Ben

Ben Carter
Clinical Research Associate
Synergy Clinical

--- Original Message ---
From: Maria Garcia <mgarcia@westwoodcrc.com>
Sent: Thursday, October 26, 2023 10:15 AM
To: Ben Carter <ben.carter@synergyclinical.com>
Cc: Dr. Emily Reed <ereed@westwoodcrc.com>
Subject: Protocol DNL-123 - Query re: Part A Screening Exclusion Criteria

Hi Ben,

Hope you're having a good week.

We have a potential healthy volunteer for Part A of the DNL-123 study who is interested in screening. During the pre-screen review, we noted their liver function tests (LFTs) are slightly above the upper limit of normal (ULN). Specifically, their ALT is 1.2x ULN.

The protocol exclusion criterion #5 states 'Clinically significant abnormal laboratory values,' but it's a bit ambiguous for this specific case. Could you please provide clarification on the acceptable range for LFTs for healthy volunteers in this part of the study? We want to ensure we are interpreting this correctly before proceeding with the formal screening visit.

Thanks for your help.

Best regards,

Maria Garcia
Clinical Research Coordinator
Westwood Clinical Research Center

Alex Johnson provides a clear answer by referencing the specific section of the protocol.
